edu.ncsu.csc316.security_manager.manager

Class SecurityTreeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.security_manager.manager.SecurityTreeManager

  • public class SecurityTreeManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the operations that the user can choose from. Manages retrieval from the trees, and allows the user to build a tree given data files.
    Author:
    Nicholas Board (ndboard)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecurityTreeManager(java.lang.String filePath)
      Constructs a new SecurityTreeManager object with the given path to the file that contains the log entries.
      SecurityTreeManager(java.lang.String preOrder, java.lang.String postOrder)
      Constructs a new SecurityTreeManager object with the given paths to the preOrder and postOrder traversal files.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAttackTreeLevelOrder()
      Returns the level order traversal of the Attack Tree as a string in the format (where each "node" is indented 3 spaces): LevelOrder[ GOAL Step[Use DDoS Attack to Disrupt All Users, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] OR Step[Attack Servers, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] OR Step[Attack Comm Infrastructure, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] ] THE LEVEL ORDER TRAVERSAL MUST NOT RETURN ANY OF THE PROPAGATED VALUES!
      java.lang.String getLogEntriesForDate(java.lang.String date)
      Returns (as a string, sorted in increasing order) the log entries for the given date in the format: LogEntry[timestamp=2015/07/17 15:49:38, user=user4, description=print calendar] LogEntry[timestamp=2015/07/17 15:55:25, user=user8, description=save immunizations]
      java.lang.String getLogTreeLevelOrder()
      Return the level order traversal of the Log Tree as a string in the format (where each "node" is indented 3 spaces): LevelOrder[ LogEntry[timestamp=2015/09/13 02:58:49, user=user2, description=save patient list] LogEntry[timestamp=2012/12/18 16:25:58, user=user18, description=view diagnoses] LogEntry[timestamp=2016/12/12 06:28:13, user=user6, description=edit patient representative list] ]
      java.lang.String propagateValues()
      Returns the values (as a string) propagated to the root node using the formulas from the project writeup.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecurityTreeManager

        public SecurityTreeManager(java.lang.String preOrder,
                           java.lang.String postOrder)
        Constructs a new SecurityTreeManager object with the given paths to the preOrder and postOrder traversal files.
        Parameters:

        postOrder - - the path to the postOrder traversal file

      • SecurityTreeManager

        public SecurityTreeManager(java.lang.String filePath)
        Constructs a new SecurityTreeManager object with the given path to the file that contains the log entries.
        Parameters:
        filePath - - the path to the log entry file

    • Method Detail

      • getAttackTreeLevelOrder

        public java.lang.String getAttackTreeLevelOrder()
        Returns the level order traversal of the Attack Tree as a string in the format (where each "node" is indented 3 spaces): LevelOrder[ GOAL Step[Use DDoS Attack to Disrupt All Users, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] OR Step[Attack Servers, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] OR Step[Attack Comm Infrastructure, C=0.00, P=0.000, I=0.00] ] THE LEVEL ORDER TRAVERSAL MUST NOT RETURN ANY OF THE PROPAGATED VALUES!
        Returns:
        the level order traversal (as a string) of the attack tree

      • getLogTreeLevelOrder

        public java.lang.String getLogTreeLevelOrder()
        Return the level order traversal of the Log Tree as a string in the format (where each "node" is indented 3 spaces): LevelOrder[ LogEntry[timestamp=2015/09/13 02:58:49, user=user2, description=save patient list] LogEntry[timestamp=2012/12/18 16:25:58, user=user18, description=view diagnoses] LogEntry[timestamp=2016/12/12 06:28:13, user=user6, description=edit patient representative list] ]
        Returns:
        the level order traversal (as a string) of the log tree

      • propagateValues

        public java.lang.String propagateValues()
        Returns the values (as a string) propagated to the root node using the formulas from the project writeup. For example: GOAL Step[Use DDoS Attack to Disrupt All Users, C=21557.12, P=0.878, I=8.00]
        Returns:
        the metric values (as a string) that are propagated to the root node

      • getLogEntriesForDate

        public java.lang.String getLogEntriesForDate(java.lang.String date)
        Returns (as a string, sorted in increasing order) the log entries for the given date in the format: LogEntry[timestamp=2015/07/17 15:49:38, user=user4, description=print calendar] LogEntry[timestamp=2015/07/17 15:55:25, user=user8, description=save immunizations]
        Parameters:
        date - - the date, in the format MM-DD-YYYY
        Returns:
        the string representation of the log entries for the specified date
